page.title: 05HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: I see the slow elegant turning of the Mill sails above the roof tops on my way to and from school. The flood lighting of the Mill makes it a striking feature of the City's skyline at night. This Windmill is unique in being a working windmill in the heart of an ancient city. It is just ten minutes walk from the Cathedral. This four sail mill is the last survivor of nine mills which once stood along Mill (formerly Mills) Road, high on the Lincoln Edge overlooking the Trent Valley. Built about 1798, it was taken over by the Ellis family in 1892 and worked until 1950's using only two sails latterly. By the early 1970's it was in an extremely derelict condition and a fire destroyed what remained of the internal fittings.
